text: Neptune Blood (junior) (1655-1716) was Anglican priest in Ireland in the late 17th and early 18th centuries ."A New History of Ireland" T. W. Moody, F. X. Martin, F.J. Byrne and Cosgrove, A: Oxford, OUP, 1976 The son of another ecclesiastical Neptune Blood"Fasti Ecclesiae Hibernicae: The succession of the prelates Volume 1" Cotton,H. p506 Dublin, Hodges & Smith, 1848–1878 he too was educated at Trinity College, Dublin."Alumni Dublinenses : a register of the students, graduates, professors and provosts of Trinity College in the University of Dublin (1593–1860George Dames Burtchaell/Thomas Ulick Sadleir p76: Dublin, Alex Thom and Co, 1935 He became Rector of Killilagh in 1680; and Treasurer of the Diocese of Kilfenora from 1688 to 1692;"Fasti Ecclesiae Hibernicae: The succession of the prelates Volume 1" Cotton,H. pp510 Dublin, Hodges & Smith, 1848–1878 and Dean of Kilfenora from 1692 until his death.Fryde, E. B.; Greenway, D. E.; Porter, S.; Roy, I. (1986). Handbook of British Chronology (Third Edition, reprinted 2003 ed.). Cambridge: Cambridge University Press. pp. 360–361 ==References== Category:Deans of Kilfenora Category:1655 births Category:1716 deaths Category:18th-century Irish Anglican priests Category:17th-century Irish Anglican priests Category:Alumni of Trinity College Dublin
title: Neptune Blood (junior)
